document_data.name: Trathake
document_data.mainbody: '''Trathake''' was a food item available in [[Khôltar]], [[south Faerûn]], ''circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1372}}.{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks archive|70}}{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks/Part 55: Khôltar, Part 6, Looking Around the Farrgaunlar}}
document_data.Description: Trathake was a popular food in busy Khôltar because it could be purchased quickly at a blurdren (local food counter) and eaten while walking or working. The basic dish was a [[bread]] bun partially hollowed out and filled with meat, then sealed with melted [[cheese]] (usually spiced with pepper). One of the worst examples of trathake cost 2 [[copper piece]]s each at [[Mother Talasko's]] where they used the fried guts of various animals on the hoof for the "meat". Better quality versions at other establishments generally cost a copper or two more.
